cab.content: Dvernment.)^ ^9^. rjruoiriiSJfis from th& porous. 9 q pMemorandum- by the President of the Board of Trade.I circulate, for the consideration of the War cabinet a Memorandum by the Coel Controller on the above subject.A, H, Stanley,Board of Trade.,15th November, 1918,Release of Miners,The prospective demand for coal during the next six months is estimated at tho rate of slightly under 260 million tons per annum,The prospective output will be at the rate of about 235 million tons per annum, after taking credit for the return of the equivalent of 50,000 Class A and Bl men from the Forces.. To meet the coal situation therefore, it is necessary arrangements should at once be made for an additional 100,000 miners to be returned from the Forces, and the authority of the War Cabinet is asked for instructions to be given to the various Forces for this to be done.Guy Calthrop. 15.11.13.
